text: Attach the string tightly about 0,3 inches (1 cm) below where you want your jar to be cut. Then cut the useless pieces of string hanging from the knot. Put alcohol on the string with the brush. Add as much as the string can absorb (be careful not to put too much of it, it mustn't flow from the string). Hold the bottom of your jar (be careful not to have alcohol on your hands) and light the string.  When the string makes a ring of fire, put the jar in the water, but make sure the water doesn't put out the flames. Wait until the jar breaks .  When you hear it's broken, make sure it did all around the jar. If it's almost done, you can finish it pulling a little with you hands. If your string run out of alcohol before it's broken, quickly put another load and do it again. Be careful with the cutting edges.
